body_html:
I hacked together a quick set_shape for SparseTensor in tensorflow/python/framework/sparse_tensor.py. I don't know if this is acceptable for merging into the main Tensorflow code but I was basically desperate for something to use for my project.

Here's the relevant part:

  def get_shape(self):
    """Get the TensorShape representing the shape of the dense tensor.
    Returns:
      A TensorShape object.
    """
    if self.static_shape is not None:
      return self.static_shape
    else:
      return tensor_util.constant_value_as_shape(self._dense_shape)

  def set_shape(self, shape):
      """Updates the shape of this tensor.
      """
      if not isinstance(shape, tensor_shape.TensorShape):
        shape = tensor_shape.TensorShape(shape)
      self.static_shape = shape

And then I added the following into init:

self.static_shape = None
body:
I hacked together a quick set_shape for SparseTensor in tensorflow/python/framework/sparse_tensor.py. I don't know if this is acceptable for merging into the  main Tensorflow code but I was basically desperate for something to use for my project.

Here's the relevant part:

```
  def get_shape(self):
    """Get the TensorShape representing the shape of the dense tensor.
    Returns:
      A TensorShape object.
    """
    if self.static_shape is not None:
      return self.static_shape
    else:
      return tensor_util.constant_value_as_shape(self._dense_shape)

  def set_shape(self, shape):
      """Updates the shape of this tensor.
      """
      if not isinstance(shape, tensor_shape.TensorShape):
        shape = tensor_shape.TensorShape(shape)
      self.static_shape = shape 
```

And then I added the following into __init__:

```
self.static_shape = None
```
